column4: Hi anybody know what the best way to install drupal on ubuntu?
It's in the repos, but I find it better to just install from the tarball.
Additionally, I like to keep my sites directory separate and just symlink it, so there's less work to do when upgrading between drupal versions and permissions can be set differently, etc.
iceroot: You can also install the Nagios Monitoring plugin for Drupal, set up Nagios, and get an e-mail and/or SMS alert when security updates are available.
